ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and become scattered dust in the air.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Turned to dust, floating in the air,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and will scatter abroad into fine dust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: they will become like dust scattered around.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So they will become like fine dust, scattered in a shaft of light.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So that they will become floating dust particles.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So that they shall be as scattered dust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So that they become a scattered dust,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and become like scattered dust particles,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So that they become dust seattered.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So that they will become floating dust particles.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:6] so that they become a scattered dust (the second idh, ‘when’, is a substitution for the first idh),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So that they become a scattered dust) like the dust which sticks to the hooves of beasts or the atoms of dust which can be seen when the rays of the sun emerge from a hole in a house or a crack in a door,
